review_title: The Best Thing in VR as of 2022
one_reviews_text:
This is the best thing currently in VR. I've gone through over 150 of the VR apps/experiences, including almost all of the relaxation ones, from the DK1 to the present, and this takes the cake. There just isn't anything like it. If you need a fully immersive vacation from real life, this is it. G&G is not a game; at least not primarily. It is a living, breathing world that you become a part of. And the devs have used the years well in perfecting the simulation. Through a series of small compromises here and there, they've fixed a lot of what often sucks about VR. The result is stunning, in terms of both scope and depth: G&G almost NEVER breaks immersion. It begins with a visually stunning, fairly on-the-rails cinematic sequence that is deeply touching, and which can be revisited chapter by chapter. After that, it turns into something that is very close to a huge, open-world sim, which can be travelled by day or night. In addition to exploring the world, you can farm. You can walk amidst the trees on rope bridges. You can enter the homes and workshops. You can paddle down a river, under logs and toward a sacred grotto. Or, if you're feeling lazy, you can hitch a raft-ride with the goblin gondoliers. And so much more. It's like the game knows what I want before I do. Graphically speaking, the world is beautiful, and there is an immense amount of activity throughout. In terms of the audio, it's virtually indistinguishable from what you'd experience in nature. In terms of comparing the impact G&G had on me, I'd have to go all the way back to the first time I logged into an MMORPG in the 90s. G&G is the only game where it feels like the simulation is running whether I am in-world or not. Asgard's Wrath has been dethroned. There is simply nothing like this, and there may never be again.

I should note that I'm running G&G almost flawlessly on a 1080 ti, with the graphics set to "Ultra". It sounds like there were some early optimization issues, but they have been fixed.
Ive been playing with vr for about a year now, exploring different titles.. This little gem is my favorite. I hope they continue to add on to Gnomes and Goblins.

I tried out this dev's demo from about 4 years ago and now a full fledged world and game has emerged. Very beautiful and detailed world, the characters are too cute for me to bear! I love the way the game is unfolding and look forward to showing this to my friends so they can see what makes VR so special.

I'd been looking forward to this game for a long time and it didn't disappoint! Yes, the opening scenes are short, and yes, it would be nice to have more guided chapters. However, it's such a joy to explore the world. I love being able to shrink down to the size of a goblin. There are a few bugs - e.g., I keep falling out of one of the treehouses when I try to follow my friend up the stairs - but it's overall a wonderful experience. I have a RTX 2070 (a bit less than the recommended 2080) and I'm able to play on the highest resolution, though sometimes I see black for a short time when I turn. This goes away on lower resolution settings.

review_title: Please get bugs fixed!! Without great!!!
one_reviews_text:
Really a real beautiful adventure, other then normal. Nice surroundings and the gameplay itself is real easy. But after 30% the game stops and freeces. After several turning of and on, boht gamelaptop and my quest 2 .  In the beginning the installing was doubtful, i had to put it on a my d disk in stead of my c. What was the reason that it had to took 27 G!!!!! Please get the bugs fixed, so i can play on. Normally i shoud  send it back, but i played it alreay for an hour or so, so i can not use the refund. 
Real pitty, if those bugs werent there it woutd be q fantastic game!
Buddy is my favorite. If you don't hear from me for a few days, come find me in the goblin forest. The story is fun, but I've loved exploring the world even more.
Impossible to play correctly, out of memory after 5 minutes. My computer has 16 Gb and GTX 2060, it work perfectly with the other games but not with this one.

really adorable, also beautiful game! it did take awhile to download since it kept restarting the download but i think that was because oculus kept updating, but it finally worked and was worth the wait!
A lovingly crafted beautiful world with lots of detailed places to explore and things to do! I
